Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: Cross312
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect to stay near Las Ramblas! It is so easy to get from the airport should you take the local bus! The bus has room for luggage and the hotel is literally 1 block and a half away from the bus stop! The hotel is very clean, people are super friendly and the area is very safe. It's a very simple hotel, so if you're looking for luxury, look another way. It's not a motel so it's worth the money you spent. We had typical european breakfast included, which is coffee and pasteries, but it's nice to have something in your belly before walking out for your adventure. Ask the front desk for advice on local eateries and best way to see the city. Although, the Filipino girl that works there seemed clueless and made many mistakes. The Spaniard girl that took the next shift completely redeemed our experience! I would definitely go back! Good price, Great Location, Easy access to public transportation and if you're all girls traveling... like we were, it felt very Safe!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Adoul
Reviews.Content: Nice location, vvery near to rambla street and metro station and good value of money

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: flossie120
Reviews.Content: excellent in every way. room equiet staff great, breakfast more tha we could eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: The3rdDon
Reviews.Content: Great location. One of the side streets along Rambla. Close to Plaza Catalunya where the Tourist Information office is not to mention train and bus stations. When you step out of the hotel, a few paces away are stores of famous retail brands. While it's a few minutes away to Barri Gotic.

Reviews.Title: “To avoid absolutely”
Reviews.Author: gijomka
Reviews.Content: Although well located, only one advice: AVOID this hotel (if you can): - comfort was poor: small room, uncomfortable and narrow bed, bad noise isolation - personel attitude: not much is done for the guests, personnel seemed not concerned by questions and requests, sometimes ironic .... - breakfast : poor and rationed, better go in coffee shop next door - internet access unstable or inexistant - dirty bed linen and towels ... and of course you have to pay in advance so forget cancellation possibilities

Reviews.Title: “Basic & Clean-- Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: wwgtam
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff, breakfast is included with price (not the best tasting but it was free), very basic but clean rooms, very close to Las Ramblas and Plaza Catalunya, free WIFI in room (super important for us!) Cons: The room had a total of 2 AC outlets, when there are 2 people with cameras and phones to charge, it can be a bit of a hassle. Slow drain in the tub, you'll have a full tub after a short shower. Questionable choice of colour/decor but who cares if you're not going to spend tons of time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “in a word, unpleasant.”
Reviews.Author: ccmaniav
Reviews.Content: Truthfully, the front desk was very friendly, but unfortunately that was the only benefit. The hotel is painted in the most unflattering shades of purple and orange, and the furniture is extremely old and questionably clean. The double room had two very poor single beds, and the rooms reeked of an odd smell. At sixty euro a night, the only true value to this hotel is if you are in a hurry to get to bed after a walk on las ramblas, in that it is only about a minute walk off of a side street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Value for Money, little Gem”
Reviews.Author: mandyfoy
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from a 4 night stay at this hotel. I think this is a great little hotel. The rooms are small but clean, staff were really friendly. I've paid a lot more for worse hotels. Yes they don't have plugs in the sink or bath, I didn't need one but am sure reception would help if you needed one. The rooms can be a bit noisy but I've experienced the same in other hotels. The breakfast was basic, (bread rolls, pastry, coffee and juice) but filled us up. The location is great, it's at the top of Las Ramblas, walking distance from most sights and the Aerobus is a 2 min walk away. Getting this bus from the airport is so simple, 5 euros for a single journey and the bus stops in the placa de catalunya a 2 min walk from the hotel (they run every 10 mins!!) We ate at the hotel one night as they do a 3 course menu including drink and service charge/vat for 10 Euros, must say this was the best meal I had during my stay and the wine I had with the meal was nice! Try the food here...... If we ever come back to Barcelona, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, best location”
Reviews.Author: Quemecostas
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night at the hotel. Efficient and freindly staffa at the reception, fast check in. The room itself was a bit old, but with window overlooking the yard of the Gothic chuch at the back of the hotel, so quiet and lots of light. Good clean, modern bathroom witha a bathtube and a hairdryer, spacios enough. The location can't be better: The shuttle bus from and to the airport stops at less than a five minute walk in Plaza de Catalunya. You are two minutes away from the Rambla and on the very edge of the Barrio Gotico. Other main attractions as Palau de la Musica are only five minutes away and main Gaudi's buildings within walkable distance. Summarizing: Not a luxury hotel at all, but very good value for yourmoney. If you want a nicer hotel, the Nouvel acros the street will do for a bunch more of euros.

Reviews.Title: “Well located functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: choonmonger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business in feb 2010. This is a clean and functional hotel just off the ramblas. Staff are helpful and polite. Rooms are Spartan and functional but again clean. Anyone expecting luxuriating in the bath can think again. Bathroom is cramped. If you are looking for a conference hotel to sleep and wash with great location in the heart of barrio gotico then this is it. Best to arrive on foot from Metro. Road access is limited as this is in the heart of the pedestrian zone. Great cafes bars Nd restaurants within falling distance.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but great location”
Reviews.Author: kemfree
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews we were a bit dubious but as our travel plans had been thrown into disarray by the Spanish Air Traffic Controllers walkout we suddenly needed overnight accommodation in Barcelona. It is located on the first side street (Carrer de Santa Anna) on the lefthand side of La Rambla coming from Place de Catalunya on an old narrow street. Reception was very friendly and helpful and our room was large but basic with very little furniture and no tea/coffee making facilities. Similar to a previous reviewer we had no lock on the bathroom door but a nice view onto a Courtyard/small square which is at the rear of the hotel. The basic continental breakfast is served at the back of their Café Bar area and tables are kept for the hotel’s guests. There are plenty of restaurants close by catering for all tastes and budgets and it would be a good base to explore the City. As Barcelona is one of the most expensive cities in Europe I suppose I would classify it as budget en-suite accommodation. The easiest and quickest way from the airport it to get the very cheap express bus to Plaça Catalunya (Plaza Catalonia) which is the Terminus and when alighting turn 90deg facing the Hard Rock Cafe and to the left of it is a small street called Avinguda del Portal de l'Angel. If you go down it Carrer de Santa Anna is the second on your right and the hotel is about 150 metres on the right opposite the Hotel Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, unhelpful/rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: Getaway333
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and quite. Windows had decent sound isolation so street noise wasn't an issue but quite neighbors are a must for a quite sleep as walls are paper-thin. What was really disappointing is the rude staff (only 1 out of 3 people working the front desk, specifically the only lady there, was helpful). We stayed at the triple room and were given only one key and were denied the second key. The doors can only be unlocked from the inside with a key - a major fire hazard if you're scrambling to find a key to get out in case of a fire emergency. Keeping that in mind, when I wanted to go out without my 2 friends who wanted to stay in, the front desk offered me to lock them in the room and take the key with me. That's ridiculous in my opinion as they wouldn't be able to get out if they needed to. When we asked for directions, they looked outraged at the fact that they needed to spend 2 minutes of their time explaining to us how to get somewhere and wouldn't repeat it twice after speeding through it just to get rid of us. I couldn't even dream of asking them where to eat and what to do as they would have simply dismissed me. They were really rude, unhelpful and unpleasant to deal with. If you're looking for a decent value, good location and don't mind dealing with rude staff, this hotel is Ok to stay in. If it wasn't for the staff, I would have given it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!..right place, right service...”
Reviews.Author: snapylace
Reviews.Content: we went for our first trip to barcelona, this hotel is on a small but safe side street off la rambla.. its at the right end of the strip for hopping on and off the bus tour - its all very walkable from this hotel..la rambla is about 1 min away with all the street artists and everything barcelona has to offer.. .i would definitely stay there again, the room was big and the cleanliness for a two star hotel was excellent. friday night we walked to excellent hard rock cafe - we didnt take breakfast at the hotel because theres lots of other places to pop into and explore right next to this location. the bar was nice and we booked flamenco at table de carmen in poble espaniol for saturday night - the receptionist was very helpful in advising us how to get there and distance/time etc and even booked the taxi for us and confirmed the price up front...the hotel is far enough away from any noise and we had two great nights sleep - if its your first trip id recommend this and if you do the flamenco at poble espaniol..walk down the hill for a taxi they are easy to get there... enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and fairly priced.”
Reviews.Author: skybluerob
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel with a perfect central location. It is on a quite side road off La Rambla, that is close to everything Barca has to offer, but quiet enough at night (with the exception of the bottle recycling lorry at 6am on sunday, but what can you do!). Staff were very polite, freindly and knowlegdable about the area. Room standard was very good for the price paid...and was clean, comfortable and secure. Breakfast is basic, coffe, oj, 2 batches 1 slice of ham, one slice of cheese...but again, for what we paid for it, we couldnt complain. All in all a great little hotel that added to a superb visit to Barca. Will be back again next September!

Reviews.Title: “Stop...and Reconsider”
Reviews.Author: Stranded-in-Italy
Reviews.Content: I can stomach just about anything. I've slept on the ground in the cold and have eaten from garbage piles so most hotels to me are just fine. However, on September 29, 2010 the public transportation system of Spain went on strike. I contacted Hotel Cortes (more than 24 hours in advance) and explained that Ryanair cancelled all flights into and out of Spain. I gave them proof that there was no way I could get to their hotel. Here's the Customer Service that I received, "I'm sorry to inform you that it's not posible to give you back the money. You need to claim to ryanair. Kind regards, Alba" It's not Ryanair's fault that Spain is on strike and they cannot reimburse someone else's responsibility. So what is this to you? You might want to stop and reconsider patronizing a place like Hotel Cortes. While I certainly hope it doesn't happen to you...it could. And like you, I did my research and I too looked forward to staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but worth it”
Reviews.Author: ZaZRhein
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for luxury, wellness and first class, then stop reading any more :-) the Hotel Cortes in Barcelona is very simple - clean chic - but price-wise what you can expect. The location is superb, just some metres off the famous Ramblas on one side and a great shopping street to the other side. The single room and bathroom were clean, for me the most important factors. What you can live without though is the breakfast. There are so many Cafes basically next door to the hotel, where you can enjoy a better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: waynelim
Reviews.Content: Located on a side street off La Rambla this hotel is very centrally located. I was worried that it would be to close to the noise and action of La Rambla but it wasn't. Even though it is 1 minute walk it is very quiet. The room was clean, decent size, and newer. We enjoyed the stay at this hotel. The a/c works very well, and the beds were okay. I slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, great location, but you won't be able to sleep in due to work on the street”
Reviews.Author: Dandy33
Reviews.Content: We paid 95 euros per night for this hotel, which was in a great location just off La Rambla, with plenty of restaurants and nightlife around (also a market, La Bouqeria is very close and definitely worth a look). The closest metro stop would be Catalunya which many of the lines run through. Our twin room was a reasonable size and clean, the beds were comfortable, and the shower had good water pressure. I think the windows were double glazed, however there was still a lot of noise coming into the room (which was on the third floor and faced on to the street) as work was being done with jackhammers etc. on the street in the morning. I'm not sure what they're doing to the street, but it only looks about half finished so I imagine the noise will be a problem for some time still. The workers didn't actually start that early, so for someone waking up at 9am I don't think this would be a problem. The breakfast (included in the price of the room) was a croissant, a bread roll, one slice of ham, one slice of cheese, a muffin and tea or coffee (no buffet). Breakfast was available till 10.30am. The free Wifi worked well in our room.

Reviews.Title: “The great location doesn't help for sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: corcaighabu
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel due to central location. From reviews I noticed that people said the rooms were small and very basic! That's pretty much spot on! Extremely basic rooms, bed cheap and tv so small you would need a pair of binoculars to watch it! But because we spent such little time in the room, this wasn't really a problem! It was the late night parties and paper thin walls that was the real bother, you really can hear everything through the walls! Had to ring reception every night about noise and when that didn't work had to throw a few of my own "not so nice" comments through the wall to shut them up! If you want a good nights sleep on a half decent bad, don't stay here! But if your going to party and want a central location it'll do fine! You could do worse than this hotel but I'm sure if you shopped around you could so much better!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sf16
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Cortes April 2010. Small hotel tucked away on St. Anna St. just off La Ramblas. Basic hotel in a great location. Close to Placa Catalunya and Airport bus dropoff and 1/2 block away from Ramlbas on busy St. Anna St. Hotel has few amenities: no internet access or availablity, 1 english tv station (BBC News), limited front desk knowledge. Room was basic bed (double) desk, chair, small tv, small bath with shower. A/C did not work, fan was on low all the time so room was always warm. Had a street room (307) so opening windows at night only let in street noise and lots of it. If you want just a basic no frills hotel room close to Ramblas for about 100Euros a night, this might be your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and basic amenities”
Reviews.Author: BostonMADiane
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel to seasoned travelers looking for a great, central location, clean accommodations, comfortable beds and plenty of hot water. This is a no frills place. I stayed for 9 nights in Feb and it was better than I expected. I got a great deal on booking.com the week before I arrived so I have no complaints. Only wish there was another English TV station but BBC World was OK and WI-FI worked fine from room. Front desk folks and ladies serving breakfast were very nice. My room was over the street on floor 3 but I was not bothered by noise. I travel a lot and always wear earplugs in hotel to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable 2-star, great location”
Reviews.Author: PCST
Reviews.Content: Excellent location -- mostly pedestrian-only street 1 block from Plaza Catalunya (and therefore easy access to metro, major city bus hub, airport bus pickup, walking into old quarter, the Ramblas, etc.). Room was pretty basic (table, 2 desk chairs, bed, no rug), but clean and plenty big for one person. Mattress was firm. Real tub in the bathroom, without the frequent problem of keeping water off the floor. Two issues with the room: minor one, I didn't even realize there WAS a safe until my last day -- it was hidden in closet behind the extra blankets. Bigger one was that there were only 2 plugs - 1 in bathroom, one high on the wall for a wall-mounted TV. I had to jury-rig something to hold the powerbrick for my computer up on the TV stand. Still, it WAS free wi-fi, which worked quite well. Desk staff was helpful, especially when maids accidentally forgot to leave any towels. Breakfast was plain -- rolls, a slice of cheese, a slice of meat. 2 star, fine for tourists, good location, central, but not on a busy street, helpful staff (especially the night clerk), nice clean basic room. Mattress was reasonably stiff. Breakfast, nyah Wireless good, but only plugs were in bathroom and high on wall for TV -- had to juryrig something to hold up my power brick. Definitely a 2 star -- maids took my towels, forgot to replace them. Laundry was available, but I had to track down the maid to get it done. I might stay here again, if I don't try one of the short term apartment-rentals that seem to be cropping up.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cortes”
Reviews.Author: SimoV
Reviews.Content: Very good situated hotel 50 m from Ramblas on Santa Ana street. Very polite personal and cleaning was ok. Room has enaugh space and badroom was big. Not noisy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but that's basically it..”
Reviews.Author: Pinayogini
Reviews.Content: If you plan to spend most of your time exploring the city and the surrounding towns, then Hotel Cortes will do. It is conveniently located in the Las Ramblas area and very close to Passeig de Gracia where you can catch the metro or the train. Hotel Cortes offers the most basic necessities but if you are booking a triple room I would suggest you ask first if the 3rd bed happens to be a fold up bed because that's what we got and it was just so flimsy. I only weight about 50kgs and when I sat in the middle of the fold up bed, it almost gave way.

Reviews.Title: “A smallish hard room with little in the way of creature comforts in the center of the action”
Reviews.Author: Oula_n_Lou
Reviews.Content: As mentioned, the location is very good. You're just steps from Las Ramblas, and all it has to offer. The front desk people were friendly and hospitable, and as we had a back room (204) there was no street noise at all, except the occasional barking of a dog and the ringing of church bells. There was some ambient hotel noise, but because I had read reviews here I downloaded an hour of gentle ocean sounds and looped it on my iPod - the white noise effectively dampened anything that might have been irritating. The room itself is sparsely decorated, all hard edges and thin scraps of fabric. It's serviceable, but understand what you're getting: a smallish hard room with little in the way of creature comforts. The bed, as mentioned by other reviewers, is shockingly uncomfortable. The matresses are like bricks, they have no padding or springs or give making sleeping on them feel like you are sleeping on the floor. After the first night I wrapped the blanket around the mattress and covered it with the sheets for a make-shift mattress pad which was only slightly better. If you are a side-sleeper I would avoid this hotel altogether; you will be miserable due to sleeping poorly and waking up with aching shoulders. The breakfast was small, but again it was about what I expected. The coffee and roll were excellent, the singe slice of meat and cheese was all I needed to start the day. If it had been larger I probably wouldn't have eaten it anyway; with so many wonderful places to eat in Barcelona, why waste valuable tummy space on a continental breakfast? Important tip: The doors do not lock automatically. When you leave your room (or when you're in it) you have to use the key to lock the door behind you. This is probably a fire code violation and definitely a safety concern. The first night we didn't realize (honestly, who would?) and slept with the door unlocked. We almost left the door unlocked when went out, but luckily I had to go back for something and noticed. Overall I would say stay here for a few days at most as a cheaper hotel right in the mix, but plan on moving somewhere to get away from the crowds, the chaos and the brick-like beds.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: silversurfer911
Reviews.Content: awful bed very noisy location Thin wall (especially when you have couples in the next room) never experienced so terrible breakfast the good location can't compensate

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveler53
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cortes was a pleasure due to the wonderful staff and the incredible location. We would definitely stay here again. We had a delightful room on the second floor facing the street...we were unsure as to whether we'd like this due to the previous reviews about noise. We were quite pleasantly surprised that the so-called noise level was merely an ugly rumor. Our stay was quiet and peaceful...we must have had a decent size room because we felt that our room and bathroom were large. We even had a foyer! Don't take a taxi to the airport. Take the airport bus. It is within walking distance and costs only 4 Euros! For breakfast...explore the surrounding restaurants. We liked eating at Santa Anna which is about 6 doors down...the scrambled eggs and fresh juice were delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, central and clean.”
Reviews.Author: culichia
Reviews.Content: I am happy with Hotel Cortes. They provided me with a descent bed. Medium size room. Room got cleaned every day. Free WIFI. And best of all, the location. Just a few steps from La Rambla. And close to Catalanya station, witch is a great starting point for most siteseeings in Barcelona. I actually got much more then I expected for a price in between €40-50 a night. The breakfast to was economy, not continental. But they provided it. So thumbs up for Hotel Cortes. They cater to most economy travlers need. If you want luxury be my guest, you for sure can find that in Barcelona, but expect to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Only Location”
Reviews.Author: Mobz11
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location in the citycenter (pl. Catalunya). The rooms are pretty small and not clean enough and the shower did not work properly. Also, the breakfast is very basic and does not worth the price paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept secret”
Reviews.Author: GaryCowan
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona in August and wanted to stay near Los Ramblas. We stumbled across the Hotel and spent 4 nights there. It was clean and the staff were very helpful. all staff spoke English and went out of their way to advise us on where to go. they arranged transport to the airport and generally were great. the hotel is a 2 star but the rooms are clean. The bathroom has a bath with a shower. The best thing about the hotel is the location, close to los ramblas and Catalunya square. You can walk just about anywhere and the metro is also very close.

Reviews.Title: “great location, hotel could use some improvements”
Reviews.Author: ahh622
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect. However, I would probably stay at another hotel next time. The rooms need a little updating - decor wise and amenity wise. The A/C barely functioned, but we were there in August in the brutal heat. We had a "double" bed that was two small twin beds pushed together. Breakfast was fine. The staff was great. The rooms just need some updates for this hotel to be a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: FluffChucker
Reviews.Content: I would concur with all the recent reviews. Perfect for a couple of days in Barcelona. Clean, quiet, pleasant staff and excellent position. What else could you ask for? My only surprise is that it's not much higher in the rankings. One tip! I usually find that dealing direct with the hotel gets you the best deal. Not in this case. I got a price from this site and rang the hotel direct. They couldn't come near it. So I booked on line and made a substantial saving.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joebella
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled to Barcelona for the May bank holiday weekend as it was also my birthday. We had booked to stay in an apartment on the outskirts of Barcelona, however, on arrival we were absolutely disgusted by the apartment and only stayed the one night before finding Hotel Cortes. We had been wandering round Las Ramblas asking in a few hotels for prices, and this is just at the top of Ramblas, just off the main street down a quiet side street, this was the cheapest hotel we had been into and the reception even gave us the key and let us go have a look at the room before we booked it for the next 2 nights which we thought was really helpful. It cost us £130 for 2 nights and this included breakfast. I usually won't stay in anything less than a 4 star hotel, so was a bit aprehensive about stayng in a 2 star, but anything had to be better than the apartment we'd stayed in! The hotel actually surprised me! The rooms were basic and a bit tired (which is what you'd expect form a 2 star), but very clean and tidied daily, and they were also extremely spacious, as was the bathroom! I stayed ina 4 star hotel in Barcelona in January 2008 and had about half the room of this hotel The breakfast wasn't anything to write home about, just a selection of pastries and some oranage juice, but there was a gorgeous bakery a few doors down where we got some really nice stuff! The location is probably one of the best things about this hotel, it is right off Las Ramblas so you're in the heart of everything and is the perfect base for exploring. To be honest when staying in somewhere like Barcelona all you want is a good base as you go out and eat in the city and you're out all day seeing the sights, and this hotel is just that. Although I still prefer my 4/5 star luxury hotels, if I'm staying in Barcelona again I will definately book here next time, and would def look at lower rated hotels when going on other city breaks!

Reviews.Title: “Budget nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lidisampa
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel near Plaza Catalunya, the room we stayed was clean, nice breakfest, safe security box in the closet. I really enjoy stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: imeldina
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to visit Barcelona. Really central, just on a sid street off Las Ramblas. Very near La Plaza de Cataluyna where the airport leaves you. The tourist bus that goes around the city leaves from there too. For those who like shopping, El Corte Ingles Fnac and all the other stores are nearby. There is also a big shopping centre about a 15 minute walk down Las Ramblas and down by the pier. The hotel was clean. The room was cleaned and the towels were changed everyday. There was a t.v. in the room. The staff were very helpful. Breakfast was fine although there was no choice. The hotel was quiet even though it looked out onto the street. Wil definitely stay here again as it is so well situated. Excellent option

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: KIWMiddlesbrough
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights for my 40th birthday. The location is excellent as the Plaza Catalunya square and the Ramblas are both 2 mins away. We took the local bus from the airport to the Plaza Catalunya square which cost 4 euros each. They run every few minutes to and from the square. The hotel (we were in room 108) was more than adequate. We over looked the front of the hotel but were not disturbed by any noise because of the shutters and double glazing. We found the staff helpful, the rooms very clean and a nice sized bathroom with bath & shower. The breakfast consited of pastries, buns, cheese, ham, orange juice & coffee. I recommend the tourist bus tour to see all the sites. We went on the red line first where you must get off and visit the Parc Guell (where the famouse moziac lizard & walls are. If the weather is nice, as it was for us, you can sit, have a drink & enjoy the atmosphere.) We then swapped to the blue line to see the olympic stadium and the coast. The tour is 20 euros for 1 day or 26 euros for 2 days and you see so much. There is a fantastic maket off the Ramblas which is also worth a visit, even just to see the non UK perfect sized fruit & veg!

Reviews.Title: “Close and Quirky”
Reviews.Author: JenEricTravelers
Reviews.Content: Located 2-min from the Plaza Catalunya it is exceptionally close to the center of Barcelona, thus Metros, A1 Airport shuttle and Information Center. The front desk staff is nice and helped us make a few phone calls and locate restaurants on the Internet and the housekeeping did well by us. English BBC is available on tv. The continental breakfast are 3-pastries, coffee and orange juice. Thankfully there are many Starbucks and Dunkin'Coffee's around. The quirks are: your room key operates the lights/tv so at night you have to manage finding the door locks (they dont lock automatically) with your hand while navigating the key to the lock from the wall. The bed was almost too uncomfortable to imagine. Our room faced the street which is noisy until 2000 and again at 0500 with deliveries. The bathroom was large but the showerhead provided entertainment by being broken. We felt safe in this hotel but it wasnt comfort. It was extremely affordable for the location! They will hold your luggage if your room isnt ready/you check out before you leave the city. There are no clocks in this room. Does it depend on the room for all these issues? I suppose so.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: oldrocker
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in side street off Les Ramblas. Ask for a top floor double with balcony/terrace with views across the roof top(Room 508/). Breakfast is at back of bar next door , just tea/coffee oj and 3 rolls/cakes. But ok to get you started. Speak english on reception, Has a lift and good value Street feels safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: youngatheart47
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights, excellent, The rooms were bright and airy and very clean, the staff on the whole were very helpful, it is situated just five minutes walk from the main square, easy to get to from the airport on the bus, i would definitly use this hotel again, their were six of us, four young at heart pensioners and two younger ones, One tip, if you are staying for a few days, buy a two day ticket on the tourist bus as you would never see all the sights otherwise, also you have to pay an entrance fee at most of the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Don´t ever book it”
Reviews.Author: CEMCDA
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in this hotel about three months ago in Venere.com and as I did it with some anticipation, they gave me a great deal in the room price. When I arrived to the Hotel, they told me I had made a reservation for a single room, one person, although I had made it for for two persons. In any case, they first told me that they had rooms for two, but it will cost me the double they had said in Venere, and when they saw I was furious, they told me they had no rooms for me and my wife. They sent me to another Hotel which is conveniently placed just in front of Cortes. They had one room and charged me what they wanted for the it (150 Euros per night - too much for a one and a half star hotel), because Barcelona was packed with people and no other rooms available in this part of the city. It was clear to me the two hotels have this procedure in their minds since they propose the huge deals to early bookers, so my advice would be DONT BOOK THERE...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rose31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago after reading several reviews and was glad we did. While not perfect and certainly not a luxury hotel ,it was clean, and despite our rooms being at the front of the hotel we heard very little noise(we stayed mid week so it may possibly be noisier on a weekend). The breakfasts were fairly poor but were served in a clean bright room leading from the bar. The bathrooms were clean and kept stocked with clean towels etc and the air conditioning was very good. The location couldnt have been better, being just a few minutes from the Placa de Catalunya where the buses to and from the airport stop and also the Bus Turistica, and Las Ramblas being just at the end of the street as well as there being plenty of shops of all types and restaurants. Iwould have no hesitation in staying here again and at 660 euros for three nights for two double rooms in July I think it was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great post cruise hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a side street off La Rambla, and only a few minutes walk to Placa Catalunya where you can catch the subway, tour buses and the airport bus. My room was clean, with marble floors throughout. The bathroom was spacious and had a wonderful and powerful shower. However, it is a tub and it can be slippery. Breakfast is included and consisted of a plate with a croissant, pastry and roll, followed by plates of ham and cheese. Coffee and orange juice is provided as well. Just enough to get the day started. Great location, very friendly and accomodating staff. Will definitely stay there again and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central location good value”
Reviews.Author: annieSuffolk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 night break, first time in Barcelona so wanted central location. This hotel was great, clean rooms, pedestrian road - safe, well lit, plenty of cafes and shops in our road. At end of Santa Ana one way you are on Las Rambla, with lots to see - other way, you are right in main shopping area. No tea making facilities in room, (we had travel kettle) but they do supply shampoo etc. Safe in room. Reasonable breakfast. We had room on top floor overlooking street, which was fine. I would go back here again. Beautiful interesting buildings everywhere. I carries most of my money in belt as had been warned of pickpockets, but felt safe here. Only problem for me as a vegeterian was that Barcelona does not cater AT ALL for non meat eaters. I had to ask for cheese omlette which was lovely, but usually NOTHING non meat on menu, and they obvioulsy thought I was mad asking. This would be a problem if I were staying for longer trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolLulu1979
Reviews.Content: We (me 27, husband 29) have just got back from a lovely 3 night break in Barcelona, staying at the Hotel Cortes, based just off La Ramblas. The hotel is basic, but clean and the location is excellent, close to all the action. From the airport we took the AeroBus, which cost 3.75 euros each and drops you off at Pl. Cataluyna – very easy and straight forward, it is then just a short walk to the hotel. The breakfast they serve is a good kick start to get you going for the day (Bread Roll, Croissant& Pastry, Cheese, Ham, Orange Juice and Coffee). There was always plenty hot water for a shower or bath. We stayed in room 201, which was spacious and overlooked a small courtyard. For being so close to the bustle of the city the room was very quiet which made for a goodnights sleep. The location was ideal for the sightseeing. We would recommend taking the bus turistic, which is an open top, hop on hop off bus service which takes you to all the sights, again leaving from Pl Catalunya. There is a north and south route and for 23 Euros you can use this for 2 days. We visited the Sagrada Familiar (go early and take the lift up to the top for amazing sights of the city), Parc Guell (lovely for a stroll in the Feb sunshine), Barcelona FC’s Nou Camp Stadium (hubby loved this as a die hard football fan and was an amazing sight compared to his home team’s Goodison Stadium, also the European Cup is based here as Barca won it in 2006 – even have your photo taken with it ), Cathedral (Lovely courtyard with geese!!) and the Picasso Museum (lots of his early work, great to see how it evolved). Would recommend all these and to spend sometime wandering around the Gothic Quarter and sitting by the harbour if the weather is nice (which it was while we were there, getting to around 20 degrees at midday – such a change to the British weather in Feb.) Would also recommend trying to get a table at El Quattre Gats (“4 Gats”), we had a lovely meal here and the atmosphere and service were excellent. Also ate at Hard Rock Café, which you know what your going to get, but has become a bit of a tradition for us to visit one in every city we go to. For those of you who like shopping there is plenty available – El Cortes Ingles in Pl Catalunya is huge, Sephora for smellies is nice and there are many Mango & Zara shops dotted about. All in all we had a fabulous few days in Barcelona and would not hesitate to go again and stay at the Hotel Cortes as there is still so much more to see and do in Barcelona. Hope this review helps

Reviews.Title: “a little gem”
Reviews.Author: manxie24
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Cortes Hotel for 1 night. I was so surprised to find it was so close to Pl. Catalunia and the Ramblas. I think it is a little gem and I would have no hesitation in staying there for a longer period. although I was in a single room, which was small but perfectly adequate with all the facilities that I needed, .When I asked the receptionist about their double rooms, I was offered a key and was pleasantly surprised at the size of a double, with a balcony. I must mention the Receptionist (Christina) she was so helpful and spoke perfect English. The continental breakfast was more than adequate and all i all, the overall cleanliness of the hotel was excellent Peter Ollerenshaw, Isle of Man
